titleStmt.title: TO THE HONOVRABLE LADIE OF HIGHEST HOPE MISTRESSE Ieane Hammiltone, Ladie Skirling.
titleStmt.author: Cockburne, James

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE HONOVRABLE LADIE OF HIGHEST HOPE MISTRESSE Ieane Hammiltone, Ladie Skirling.
analytic.author: Cockburne, James

div.head: TO THE HONOVRABLE LADIE OF HIGHEST HOPE MISTRESSE Ieane Hammiltone, Ladie Skirling.
div.p: HOnourable Ladie, hauing nothing of vvorth to present your Ladishippe, I haue presumde to offer to the Schryne of your gratious clemencie the humble sacrifice of my deuote sinceritie: vvhereby I haue bevvrayed rather a vvill to obey, then any skill to deserue your Ladiships protection. For (vvell I vvotte) these fevv disordered lynes are too vveake a prop to beare the burthene of your al-fleing fame. Yet calling to mynde your Ladiships vvorthie disposition, I am persvvaded my attempts vvill rather be buryed in silence, nor smyled at vvith disdaine, and the rather be bucaus I am obligate your Ladieships in all devvties euer and euer.

closer.dateline: From Cambusnethane the xxv of December.
